summary: This document is a chain of internal emails from November 12, 2020, between FBI and DOJ public affairs officials discussing media coordination regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It references a planned briefing for victims, a draft DOJ press statement, and news articles about the probe and the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Stacie
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who was spoken to regarding a draft press statement from the DOJ about the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Amy Thorenson
persons.context: Copied on an email as the NY Public Affairs Specialist for the FBI, involved in the media coordination discussion.

events.title: Planned Victim Briefing and Media Coordination
events.description: The FBI and DOJ discuss a media plan regarding a DOJ OPR report on the Epstein probe, including a briefing to be given to victims in Miami and a draft DOJ press statement set for potential release.

events.title: NY Post Article on FBI Briefing
events.description: A New York Post article is cited, reporting that the FBI is hosting a briefing regarding the current Jeffrey Epstein investigation findings with victims.

events.title: Miami Herald Article on Maxwell Case
events.description: A Miami Herald story from the previous day suggests new information potentially revealing witness identities in the Ghislaine Maxwell case may be released because a court deadline for objections passed.

keyFacts: On November 12, 2020, the FBI and DOJ were coordinating a media response and a victim briefing related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
A DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) report on the Epstein probe was the subject of the planned briefing to victims.

Media attention was focused on a New York Post article about the FBI sharing findings with victims and a Miami Herald article about potential witness identity disclosure in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The correspondence shows internal government coordination on public messaging regarding a high-profile, ongoing investigation.
